payload.title: Implement roci-agent aligned to pi-mono agent runtime
Implement MCP stdio transport (spawn process, JSON-RPC over stdin/stdout)
Implement MCP SSE transport (HTTP SSE client for remote servers)
Implement MCPToolAdapter bridge (MCP tools â†’ roci Tool trait)
Implement RealtimeSession::connect() WebSocket to OpenAI realtime API
Add unit tests for auth providers (ClaudeCode, GitHubCopilot, OpenAICodex)
Add unit tests for stream_transform (filter, map, buffer, throttle)
Add unit tests for config (RociConfig::from_env, AuthValue::resolve)
Add unit tests for error (category, is_retryable, recovery_suggestion)
Add unit tests for util (RetryPolicy, ResponseCache, UsageTracker)
Define AgentMessage enum wrapping ModelMessage + custom variants with convertToLlm
Define AgentEvent enum (agent_start/end, turn_start/end, message_start/update/end, tool_execution_start/update/end)
Define AgentTool trait extending Tool with label, streaming on_update callback, and AbortSignal
Implement agent loop core: outer loop (follow-ups) + inner loop (tool calls + steering)
Implement steering messages: check between tool executions, skip remaining, inject before next LLM call
Implement follow-up messages: check after natural loop end, restart if queued
Implement transformContext hook: async pre-LLM message transformation
Implement tool argument validation against JSON schema before execution
Implement observable agent state with event subscription (subscribe/listener pattern)
Implement dynamic API key resolution (per-request async getApiKey callback)
Thread session ID through to provider requests for prompt caching
Add roci-agent feature flag and wire into Cargo.toml
Write comprehensive tests for agent loop (steering, follow-ups, tool execution, events)
Write example: roci-agent with tools showing steering + follow-up patterns
Implement MCP streamable HTTP/SSE transport via rmcp
Implement MCPClient initialize + list_tools + call_tool via rmcp client

payload.description: Replace stdio transport stub with rmcp child-process transport wrapper. Include process lifecycle, cancellation, timeouts, clean shutdown, and error mapping into RociError. Add integration tests against a fixture MCP server process.

Implement remote MCP transport using rmcp streamable HTTP client (including SSE event flow where required by server). Support headers/auth, request timeout/retry controls, and transport close semantics. Add integration tests with a mock MCP HTTP server.

Implement MCPClient methods: initialize handshake/capability negotiation, tools/list retrieval, tools/call execution. Ensure robust protocol validation, structured error mapping, and cancellation behavior. Cover malformed payloads and timeout paths with tests.

Implement MCPToolAdapter bridging MCP-discovered tools into Roci DynamicToolProvider. Map MCP input schema to DynamicTool schema, execute tools with ToolArguments + ToolExecutionContext metadata, and preserve error/result semantics. Add e2e adapter tests.

Implement RealtimeSession::connect using OpenAI Realtime WebSocket API with auth headers, session initialization, event parsing, heartbeat/keepalive, reconnect strategy, and graceful close behavior. Add integration tests with mock WebSocket server.

Add concrete OpenAI Whisper transcription provider implementing AudioProvider. Support multipart upload, language hints, MIME/content validation, timeout/retry handling, and robust error mapping. Add unit/integration tests using wiremock.

Add concrete OpenAI text-to-speech provider implementing SpeechProvider. Support format/voice/speed options, binary audio response handling, timeout/retry behavior, and structured provider errors. Add unit/integration tests.

Implement AuthManager file persistence for credentials.json: load/save APIs, schema validation, atomic writes, secure file permissions, and corruption recovery behavior. Add tests for round-trip and failure paths.
Add comprehensive tests for ClaudeCodeAuth, GitHubCopilotAuth, and OpenAiCodexAuth including success flows, token refresh behavior, pending/slowdown/denied states, and error mapping.
Add full unit test matrix for stream transforms (filter/map/buffer/throttle): correctness, ordering, flush semantics, and error propagation.
Add tests for configuration/auth value resolution: RociConfig::from_env mapping precedence and AuthValue::resolve behavior for ApiKey/BearerToken/EnvVar with failure paths.
Add tests for error classification helpers (category, retryability, recovery suggestions), ensuring stable mappings across major RociError variants.
Add deep tests for utility modules RetryPolicy, ResponseCache, and UsageTracker covering correctness, time-dependent behavior, and concurrency edges.
Integrate rmcp child-process transport and replace stdio stub plumbing in MCP transport layer.
payload.title: Wire rmcp child-process transport wrapper

payload.description: Handle process lifecycle, cancellation, graceful shutdown, and deterministic error mapping for stdio transport.
payload.title: Implement stdio lifecycle/cancel/close semantics

payload.description: Add fixture-based integration tests for happy path, unexpected process exit, and timeout/cancel behavior.
payload.title: Add stdio integration tests

payload.title: Define Agent runtime state + API surface
Implement rmcp-based MCP transport layer (stdio + sse)

payload.text: Added github_copilot_auth_tests: device flow pending/slow_down/denied/authorized/expired, poll errors, exchange not-logged-in/401/500, cache-hit + near-expiry refresh, invalid expires_at.
Added claude_code_auth_tests: import missing/oauth-null/success/profile-isolation/invalid-json plus logged_in/get_token coverage.
Added shared tests/auth_support fixture (in-memory TokenStore/token helper) and malformed/partial response regressions across provider tests.
Added openai_codex_auth_tests: device start pending/authorized/exchange-failure/expired, import auth.json variants, refresh success + invalid grant + missing refresh token.
Implemented auth provider expansion via new tests/auth_support + claude_code_auth_tests + github_copilot_auth_tests + openai_codex_auth_tests; all focused tests pass (31/31).
Final focused run: cargo test --test claude_code_auth_tests --test github_copilot_auth_tests --test openai_codex_auth_tests => 33 passed, 0 failed.
Implemented OpenAiWhisperTranscriptionProvider with MIME/content validation, manual multipart upload, timeout+retry, error mapping; added wiremock tests in tests/audio_openai_provider_tests.rs.
Implemented OpenAiTtsProvider with voice/format/speed mapping, response MIME/empty-body checks, timeout+retry, structured provider error mapping; added wiremock tests.

Implemented realtime websocket connect/auth/bootstrap parsing with heartbeat, reconnect/backoff, graceful close; added mock websocket integration tests in tests/realtime_session_tests.rs (happy path, auth failure, disconnect/reconnect). Verified via cargo test --features audio --test realtime_session_tests -- --nocapture.

payload.description: Track and close remaining core-loop parity gaps vs pi-mono discovered during roci alignment work. Scope excludes TUI.
payload.title: pi-agent core parity follow-ups (non-TUI)

payload.description:
Problem: openai:* models containing substring 'codex' are auto-routed to openai-codex, which can misroute custom/FT models.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Only explicit codex providers/aliases (openai-codex/openai_codex/codex) route to OpenAiCodex by default.
2) Any additional heuristic must be explicit, documented, and covered by tests for non-codex false positives.
3) Add/adjust selector tests for routing matrix and preserve existing passing cases.
payload.title: Harden model selector codex routing heuristic

payload.description:
Design task for message extensibility in core loop.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Propose API for agent-side message abstraction and conversion into provider ModelMessage set before sanitize/provider call.
2) Define compatibility strategy with existing transform_context and tool result persistence hooks.
3) Document migration plan with minimal breakage and test strategy (unit + runner-level).
4) Capture performance and safety constraints (no role leakage to providers).
payload.title: Design extensible message conversion path (convert_to_llm parity)

payload.description:
Implement approved conversion design from prior task.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Introduce conversion hook/path in runtime/runner that supports filtering/transforming non-LLM messages before provider request.
2) Preserve current behavior when hook is unset.
3) Add tests for conversion correctness, skipped messages, and tool-call loop stability.
4) Update docs/examples for new hook usage.
payload.title: Implement message conversion integration in runner/runtime

payload.description:
Add controlled runtime mutators for parity with pi-agent ergonomic APIs.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Add safe setters/replacers for system prompt, tools, and conversation messages (and model if supported) with state guards.
2) Define behavior while running (reject vs queue) and test it.
3) Ensure snapshot/state watchers reflect updates deterministically.
4) Document API contract and thread-safety semantics.
payload.title: Add AgentRuntime mutability APIs (model/system prompt/tools/messages)

payload.description:
Add queue controls without full reset.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Add APIs: clear_steering_queue, clear_follow_up_queue, clear_all_queues, has_queued_messages.
2) Preserve existing drain-mode semantics (All/OneAtATime).
3) Add unit tests for queue state transitions and interactions with continue_without_input.
4) Ensure reset behavior remains backward-compatible.
payload.title: Add fine-grained queue management APIs (steering/follow-up)

payload.description:
Transport is now plumbed into ProviderRequest but mostly unused by providers.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Define transport contract (allowed values and behavior) at provider boundary.
2) Implement at least one meaningful transport branch (e.g., direct vs proxy/custom backend) or explicitly reject unsupported values with clear error.
3) Add provider + runner tests proving transport alters behavior when configured.
4) Update docs/config examples.
payload.title: Make transport preference effective in provider execution path

payload.description: Address final non-TUI parity gaps vs pi-agent: agent-level streaming message lifecycle events and tool execution update streaming, with end-to-end tests/docs.
payload.title: Close remaining pi-agent core parity gaps (streaming events + tool updates)

payload.description:
Gap: MessageStart/MessageUpdate/MessageEnd-style event flow is not fully emitted from loop execution.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Define canonical event emission contract for assistant message lifecycle (start/update/end) including text and reasoning deltas.
2) Emit lifecycle events consistently in runner for normal completion, tool-call turns, cancellation, and failure paths.
3) Ensure ordering guarantees are documented and tested (no missing end events on terminal states where applicable).
4) Add runner/runtime tests validating event payload shape, sequence, and compatibility with existing sinks.
payload.title: Implement agent-level message lifecycle streaming events end-to-end

payload.description:
Gap: ToolExecutionUpdate exists in types but runner tool execution path does not stream updates/cancellation semantics end-to-end.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Runner uses tool extended execution path with update callback plumbing and cancellation wiring.
2) Emit ToolExecutionUpdate events during long-running tool execution with deterministic ordering relative to ToolExecutionStart/End.
3) Preserve backward compatibility for tools implementing only basic execute().
4) Add tests with stub tool emitting incremental updates; verify sink receives updates and final result semantics are unchanged.
payload.title: Implement tool execution update streaming via execute_ext callback

payload.description:
Cross-cutting closure task to ensure both parity gaps are production-ready.
Acceptance criteria:
1) Add/extend integration tests covering mixed text+reasoning+tool updates over a full run loop.
2) Update docs for event contracts and tool update semantics, including edge cases (cancel/fail/retry).
3) Validate no regressions in existing agent runtime/runner/provider tests.
4) Produce concise parity checklist confirming both gaps are fully closed.
payload.title: Parity hardening: integration coverage, docs, and release criteria

payload.text: Implemented runner parity: MessageStart/Update/End emission (text+reasoning), ToolExecutionStart/Update/End via execute_ext callback, cancellation token wiring for in-flight tools, and docs in docs/learned/agent-events-tool-updates.md. Verified with cargo test --features cli,default runner::tests (20 passed).

payload.description: Define/lock library-facing MCP contracts for transport bootstrap, server identity, instruction exposure, and aggregation semantics.
payload.title: Finalize MCP library contracts + spec

payload.description: Implement rmcp session bootstrap from MCPTransport in MCPClient so stdio/sse can initialize without pre-attached RunningService.
payload.title: Implement MCPClient transport->session bootstrap

payload.description: Add multi-server MCP aggregation (tool discovery + execution routing + collision policy) as a first-class library component.
payload.title: Implement multi-server MCP aggregation

payload.description: Surface MCP server instructions in library APIs and provide deterministic merge helpers for agent/system prompt composition.
payload.title: Implement MCP server instruction integration

payload.description: Wire MCP dynamic tool provider(s) into core agent/runtime APIs so library consumers can use MCP tools without CLI-specific glue.
payload.title: Integrate MCP providers into core agent/runtime API

payload.description: Ship e2e/integration coverage for stdio+sse+multi-server+instructions and update docs/gap analysis to mark MCP parity complete.
payload.title: E2E tests, docs, and parity closeout

payload.description:
Enforce strict separation of concerns so `roci` core remains UI-agnostic and `roci-cli` is a consumer-only UX layer.

Scope:
- Move CLI modules into separate crate(s)
- Convert auth code to pure services
- Remove CLI-specific wording from core errors
- Optionally extract built-in coding tools out of core
- Update docs/tests/release notes for migration
payload.title: Strict SoC migration: split roci core from CLI surfaces

payload.description:
Decide migration contract before code moves:
- Breaking-change policy for removing `roci::cli` module and `cli` feature from core
- Workspace layout and crate naming (`crates/roci-cli` + optional tools crate)
- Scope/timing for built-in tool extraction
- Error taxonomy changes needed for CLI-agnostic core

Output: short ADR-style note and task-level acceptance criteria for execution tasks.
payload.title: SoC decisions + ADR for CLI/core boundary migration

payload.description:
Create workspace/package scaffolding for `crates/roci-cli` while keeping behavior unchanged.

Acceptance criteria:
1) `roci-cli` crate exists and builds.
2) Binary name remains `roci`.
3) Core crate no longer owns CLI binary wiring.
4) CI/test commands updated for workspace-aware invocation.
payload.title: Create workspace scaffolding for crates/roci-cli

payload.description:
Move CLI parser/orchestration/auth command handlers from core into `crates/roci-cli`.

Acceptance criteria:
1) `src/main.rs` + `src/cli/*` functionality migrated to CLI crate.
2) CLI command behavior remains equivalent (auth/chat flows).
3) No `clap` usage remains in core crate.
4) Core library public API no longer exports CLI module.
payload.title: Migrate CLI entrypoints/commands into roci-cli crate

payload.description:
Refactor authentication flows to pure service APIs in core (no stdout/stderr/process::exit).

Acceptance criteria:
1) Core auth APIs return typed results/errors only.
2) Interactive prompting/printing/exit mapping is done in CLI crate.
3) Existing auth providers remain functionally equivalent.
4) Auth integration/unit tests cover service-level behavior.
payload.title: Refactor core auth into pure service APIs (no terminal/exit)

payload.description:
Remove CLI-specific guidance from core provider errors and introduce UI-agnostic typed error mapping.

Acceptance criteria:
1) Core errors avoid command suggestions like `Run: roci ...`.
2) Missing credential/config errors are typed and machine-mappable.
3) CLI layer maps typed errors to actionable help text.
4) Provider tests updated for new error expectations.
payload.title: Make core provider errors CLI-agnostic + add CLI error mapping

payload.description:
Optional boundary hardening: extract built-in coding tools (`tools::builtin`) into dedicated crate (`roci-agent-tools` or `roci-cli-tools`).

Acceptance criteria:
1) Core keeps tool abstractions but not opinionated local shell/fs tool bundle.
2) CLI imports built-in tools from extracted crate.
3) Migration note documents any API changes.
4) Decision recorded whether this split ships now or follow-up.
payload.title: Optional: extract built-in coding tools into separate crate

payload.description:
Cross-cutting verification and documentation for SoC migration.

Acceptance criteria:
1) Docs explain new crate boundaries and ownership.
2) Workspace test matrix passes (core + CLI + affected integration tests).
3) Compatibility/upgrade notes published for downstream users.
4) Final checklist confirms strict SoC goals are met.
payload.title: SoC migration hardening: docs, tests, upgrade checklist

payload.text: Open questions to resolve before implementation: (1) default tool collision policy across servers (namespace/fail/first), (2) default instruction merge policy (prepend/append/separate-system-message helper), (3) multi-server init behavior (partial availability vs fail-fast strict), (4) reconnect/version fallback scope for this task.

Decision lock (2026-02-25): 1) collision policy=A auto-namespace (<server_id>__<tool_name>), 2) multi-server init policy=B fail-fast strict default, 3) instruction merge policy=A append MCP instruction block after existing system prompt, 4) reconnect/version fallback scope=A include in this task.
Decision lock inherited from .1: 1A,2B,3A,4A.
Decision lock update (2026-02-25): expose server labels directly in merged instruction prompt as [server:<id>] entries in deterministic order.
Instruction merge format locked: merged text must include explicit [server:<id>] labels visible to model.

payload.description: Refactor large file src/mcp/transport.rs (>500 LOC) into smaller modules.
payload.title: Refactor mcp transport module
Extract built-in coding tools into roci-tools crate

payload.description:
# ADR: CLI / core separation of concerns

## Goal
Capture the final SoC decision: `roci` core is UI-agnostic; `roci-cli` owns CLI UX; `roci-tools` owns built-in coding tools.

## Scope
- Create `docs/architecture/cli-soc.md` with:
  - Context/problem statement
  - Decision summary
  - Consequences (binary rename, tool path, error mapping)
  - Ownership boundaries per crate
- Add `read_when` entry in `docs/learned/LEARNINGS.md` pointing to this ADR.

## Acceptance criteria
1) ADR file exists at `docs/architecture/cli-soc.md`.
2) `docs/learned/LEARNINGS.md` updated with a `read_when` link.
3) ADR content reflects decisions in `tsq-jwv1ysxb.1`.
payload.title: ADR: CLI/core SoC boundary

payload.description: Implement pre/post tool hooks in roci-core and AgentRuntime before extensions. Decisions: 1A pre_tool_use supports continue|block|replace_args. 2A pre-hook error => structured tool error result (run continues per normal limits). 3A post-tool hook may mutate content/details/is_error. 4B remove legacy tool_result_persist path (breaking); migrate all internal call-sites/docs/tests. 5A no dedicated hook timeout; rely on cancellation tokens/run cancellation.
payload.title: First-class tool hook lifecycle in roci-core

payload.description: In crates/roci-core/src/agent_loop/runner.rs replace RunHooks.tool_result_persist with first-class hook contracts. Add pre_tool_use async hook (continue|block(reason)|replace_args) and post_tool_use async hook (full call context + mutable result). Include cancellation token on pre hook payload. Keep API names stable and documented.
payload.title: Runner API: add pre_tool_use/post_tool_use hook contracts

payload.description: Add runner + runtime tests for: pre_hook block, pre_hook arg rewrite, pre_hook error => structured tool error, post_hook mutation, parallel isolation, cancellation behavior. Add/adjust tests removing legacy tool_result_persist assumptions.

payload.description: Wire new hooks into execute_tool_call / append tool result flow so both single and parallel tool execution obey the same semantics. pre_hook block or error must produce structured tool error result; post_hook may mutate result before persistence/events/model message. Remove legacy tool_result_persist usage entirely.
payload.title: Runner execution wiring: apply pre/post hooks across single+parallel tool paths
